## Outline
  1. Quantum ChromoDynamics in the continuum
  2. Why QCD is challenging
  3. The lattice QCD approach and Monte Carlo simulations
  4. The need for supercomputers
  5. Open questions and challenges
## QCD in the Continuum {auto-animate=true auto-animate-easing="ease-in-ease-out" auto-animate-duration=1}
$$\mathcal{L}_{\mathrm{QCD}} =\mathcal{L}_{\mathrm{gauge}}+\mathcal{L}_{\mathrm{matter}}$$
## QCD in the Continuum {auto-animate=true auto-animate-easing="ease-in-ease-out" auto-animate-duration=1}
$$\mathcal{L}_{\mathrm{QCD}} =-\tfrac{1}{2}\mathrm{Tr}\left[ F_{\mu\nu} F^{\mu\nu}\right]+\sum_{f=1}^{N_f} \bar{\psi}_f \big( i \gamma^\mu D_\mu - m_f \big) \psi_f$$
## QCD in the Continuum {auto-animate=true auto-animate-easing="ease-in-ease-out" auto-animate-duration=1}
$$\mathcal{L}_{\mathrm{QCD}} =\textcolor{#EB811B}{-\tfrac{1}{2}\mathrm{Tr}\left[F_{\mu\nu} F^{\mu\nu}\right]} +\sum_{f=1}^{N_f} \bar{\psi}_f \big( i \gamma^\mu D_\mu - m_f \big)\psi_f$$
:::: {.columns } ::: {.column width="50%" style="margin-top:0px;"} ::: {class="fragment"} - **Gauge fields**:
$$\normalsize A_\mu(x) = \sum_{a=1}^8 A_\mu^a(x)\, T^a$$
- $\small \left[ T_a,T_b\right]= i f_{abc}T_c$ and $\small \left\{ T_a,T_b\right\}= \frac 1 2 \delta_{ab}$ - $\small A_\mu(x)$ encapsulates the 8 gluons - $\small A_\mu^a(x)\in \mathfrak{su}(3)$. ::: ::: {class="fragment"} - **Field strength tensor**:
$$ F_{\mu\nu} = \partial_\mu A_\nu - \partial_\nu A_\mu - i g \,[A_\mu, A_\nu] $$
::: ::: ::: {.column width="50%" style="margin-top:0px;"} ::: {class="fragment"} - **Gauge transformations**: $\small \forall\; U(x) \in \mathrm{SU}(3)$
$$ \begin{array}{rcl} A_\mu & \longrightarrow & UA_\mu U^\dagger \\ F_{\mu\nu} & \longrightarrow & U\,F_{\mu\nu}\,U^\dagger \end{array} $$
::: ::: {class="fragment" style="margin-top:-27px"} - **Covariance**: - $\small F_{\mu\nu}$ transforms *homogeneously* - $\small \mathrm{Tr}[F_{\mu\nu}F^{\mu\nu}]$ is **gauge invariant** ::: ::: :::: ::: {class="fragment" style="font-size:1.0em; font-style:italic; color:gray; margin-top:-20px; margin-right:0px; text-align:right;"} **[Pure gauge]{style="color: #EB811B;"} → already highly non-trivial:** confinement, glueballs, non-linear self-interactions... ::: ## QCD in the Continuum {auto-animate=true auto-animate-easing="ease-in" auto-animate-duration=0.0}
$$\mathcal{L}_{\mathrm{QCD}} = -\tfrac{1}{2}\mathrm{Tr}\left[F_{\mu\nu} F^{\mu\nu}\right] +\textcolor{#EB811B}{\sum_{f=1}^{N_f} \bar{\psi}_f \big( i \gamma^\mu D_\mu - m_f \big)\psi_f}$$
:::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="50%" style="margin-top:0px;"} ::: {class="fragment"} - **Quark fields**: - $\small \psi_f(x)$ → flavor $\small f=1,\dots,N_f$ - Real world → $\small N_f = 6$ - Fundamental rep. of $\small \mathrm{SU}(3)_C$ - $\small \psi_f(x)$ → $\small (\textcolor{red}{\psi_f(x)}, \textcolor{green}{\psi_f(x)}, \textcolor{blue}{\psi_f(x)})$ ::: ::: {class="fragment" } - **Covariant derivative**: $$D_\mu = \partial_\mu - i g A_\mu$$ - Couples quarks to gluons - Ensures **local gauge invariance** ::: ::: ::: {.column width="50%" style="margin-top:0px;"} ::: {class="fragment"} - **Gauge transformations**: $\small \forall\; U(x) \in \mathrm{SU}(3)$
$$ \begin{array}{rcl} \psi_f & \longrightarrow & U\,\psi_f \\ \bar{\psi}_f & \longrightarrow & \bar{\psi}_f\,U^\dagger \\ D_\mu \psi_f & \longrightarrow & U\,D_\mu \psi_f \end{array} $$
::: ::: {class="fragment" style="margin-top:-27px"} - **Facts**: Quarks are never observed as free particles - Combined into **color singlets** → hadrons - mesons ( $\small \pi^{\pm}, \pi^0\dots$) - baryons ( $\small p,n\dots$) ::: ::: :::: ## Chiral Limit in QCD {auto-animate=true} ::: {class="fragment"} **Chiral Transformations**:
$$\psi \;\longrightarrow\; e^{\,i \alpha \gamma_5/2}\, \psi;\quad \quad \bar{\psi} \;\longrightarrow\; \bar{\psi}\, e^{\,i \alpha \gamma_5/2}$$
in the $\small m_f \to 0$ is a symmetry of the Lagrangian ::: :::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="50%" style="margin-top:0px;"} ::: {class="fragment"} - **Left / Right modes**: $$ \psi_L = P_L \psi, \quad \psi_R = P_R \psi $$ with $P_{L,R} = \frac{1\mp\gamma_5}{2}$ ::: ::: ::: {.column width="50%" style="margin-top:0px;"} ::: {class="fragment" style="margin-top:-24px;"} - $$ \bar{\psi}\, i\gamma^\mu D_\mu \psi = \bar{\psi}_\textcolor{red}{\small L} i\gamma^\mu D_\mu \psi_\textcolor{red}{\small L} + \bar{\psi}_\textcolor{blue}{\small R} i\gamma^\mu D_\mu \psi_\textcolor{blue}{\small R} $$
→ does **not mix** chirality
::: ::: {class="fragment" style="margin-top:-30px;" } - $$ \,\bar{\psi}m\psi = \bar{\psi}_\textcolor{red}{\small L} m \psi_\textcolor{blue}{\small R} + \bar{\psi}_\textcolor{blue}{\small R} m \psi_\textcolor{red}{\small L} $$
→ explicitly **couples** $\textcolor{red}{\small L}$ and $\textcolor{blue}{\small R}$
::: ::: :::: ::: {class="fragment" style="margin-top:20px;"} - **Chiral limit**: $\small m_u = m_d = 0$ ⇒ $\small \mathrm{SU}(2)_V \times \mathrm{SU}(2)_A \times \mathrm{U}(1)_V$ is a **global symmetry**: - QCD spectrum **does not show parity doubling**. ::: ## Chiral symmetry breaking in real QCD :::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="50%" style="margin-top:30px;"} ::: {class="fragment" style="margin-top:-20px;"} 1. **Spontaneous breaking** - $\small \langle \bar{\psi}\psi \rangle \neq 0$ (non-trivial QCD vacuum) - $\small \mathrm{SU}(2)_V \times \mathrm{SU}(2)_A \times \mathrm{U}(1)_V \;\;\longrightarrow\;\; \mathrm{SU}(2)_V \times \mathrm{U}(1)_V$ - 3 Nambu–Goldstone bosons ⇒ the **pions** 2. **Explicit breaking** - light quark masses $\small m_{u,d} \neq 0$ - GMOR: $\small{ M_{\pi}^2 = (m_u + m_d)}\frac{\large \langle \bar{\psi}\psi \rangle}{\large f_{\pi}^2} \simeq 135 \mathrm{\, MeV}$ ::: ::: ::: {.column width="50%" style="margin-top:20px;"} ::: :::: ## Prova {auto-animate=true} :::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="50%" style="margin-top:0px;"} ::: {class="fragment"} **Chiral Transformations**: $$ \psi \;\to\; e^{\,i \alpha \gamma_5/2}\, \psi, \quad \bar{\psi} \;\to\; \bar{\psi}\,e^{\,i \alpha \gamma_5/2} $$ - Symmetry for $\;m_f \to 0$ ::: ::: {class="fragment"} **Left / Right modes**: $$ \psi_{L,R} = P_{L,R}\psi, \quad P_{L,R}=\tfrac{1\mp\gamma_5}{2} $$ - Kinetic term: $\bar\psi i\slashed{D}\psi = \bar\psi_L i\slashed{D}\psi_L + \bar\psi_R i\slashed{D}\psi_R$ → does **not mix** chirality - Mass term: $\bar\psi m \psi = \bar\psi_L m \psi_R + \bar\psi_R m \psi_L$ → couples L/R ::: ::: ::: {.column width="50%" style="margin-top:0px;"} ::: {class="fragment"} **In the chiral limit** ($m_{u,d}=0$): - Global symmetry $\mathrm{SU}(2)_V \times \mathrm{SU}(2)_A \times \mathrm{U}(1)_V$ - No parity doubling in the spectrum ::: ::: {class="fragment"} **In real QCD**: 1. **Spontaneous breaking** - $\langle \bar\psi\psi \rangle \neq 0$ - $\mathrm{SU}(2)_A$ broken → 3 NG bosons = pions 2. **Explicit breaking** - small $m_{u,d}\neq 0$ - GMOR: $M_\pi^2 \sim (m_u+m_d)\,\langle\bar\psi\psi\rangle/f_\pi^2$ ::: ::: :::: ## QCD in the continuum :::{.r-hstack style="align-items:center; justify-content:center; margin-top:300px"} ::: ## QCD in the continuum
